name: Toyoko Inn Haneda Airport 2

reviews.text: We stayed in a twin room for one night between a late arriving international flight and early departing domestic flight the next morning.
reviews.title: Excellent value near Haneda

reviews.text: This hotel is a nice basic business hotel. It's very clean. Service is helpful and polite. The free shuttle gets you there quickly. It's also immediately next to the Otorii station on the Keikyu line. This line takes you directly to Haneda and connects to the JR line at Shinagawa.
reviews.title: An okay hotel to get to Haneda airport

reviews.text: The room is very very small but it's well designed so it works. Air conditioning works well. Everything is clean.
reviews.title: Value after a long flight

reviews.text: We left for our flight before breakfast started, but they had pastries for us to take which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great airport stay for late night arrivals or early morning departure!

reviews.text: I'm giving it 5 stars because it does what it says it will do. It's not a resort but if you want a nice budget accommodation, this is a great option.
reviews.title: Great for transit stay

reviews.text: This hotel provides free shuttle from the airport, and location is very close to train station so perfect for just an overnite stay before continue journey to the city center.
reviews.title: overnight stay
Great Value and location for Haneda
reviews.text: Room is small, but it's pretty complete (even a safe deposit box).

Price was right and the location was great for a midnight arrival. Free shuttle bus and breakfast (nothing fancy). Close to the train station and 7/11. Typical Japanese business hotel. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Great for access to haneda airport

reviews.text: Stayed here taking a guess about how easy it was to access haneda airport early in the morning.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: First, haneda airport doesn't open until 430am. My partner had a 630am flight and the shuttle from the hotel at 415 was great. Second, it's right next to Oita station, so no need to catch the mono rail if you're not going to the airport. Third, there's a fantastic restaurant right on top of the station exit right next to the hotel. We rang at the last minute and could only get a smoking room (and are non smokers) but it wasn't bad after opening the window.
reviews.title: Close to Haneda - good for a night

reviews.text: We arrived late at night from the US, and our next flight within Japan was scheduled to depart at 8am. The front desk staff spoke English and check-in went quickly. The room was small for two people but clean. In the bathroom, there was a bathtub with a showerhead connected to the sink. The toilet was a standard Japanese toilet. There was body wash and shampoo in dispensers on the wall. We basically showered and slept for a few hours before taking the free hotel shuttle back to Haneda Airport. The hotel offers a free breakfast but we checked out before the start of breakfast.
reviews.title: Good for Haneda layover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wasn't keen to stay here but because our flight arrived late (almost midnight) and we thought we would be better to stay at the nearest hotel for quick night. It's not the nearest but at least it provides free shuttles which is good, knowing that there might be surcharge if we were to take cab. Besides, they also provide breakfast (western or simple japanese) buffet. But the room is so small that we had some difficulties accessing our luggage (tho it's econ double room). As mentioned, our intention was to have a night stay so we didn't literally check out others amenities.
reviews.title: Last in choice

reviews.text: My AA flight arrived late. All trains out of Haneda stop at midnight. This Toyoko-Inn is great. Free Shuttle, back and forth. Rooms are comfortable and clean. This is probably the only Toyoko-Inn that I have stayed at where the front staff understand English. I was able to book a single non-smoking room at USD$ 70. I am a Toyoko-Inn member, so that helps. Took the Free Shuttle back the next day to the Airport. Oh, and let's not forget the Free Breakfast. Nice touch.
reviews.title: The AA Haneda trap....

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on an overnight layover. The shuttle was ok to find -- since the domestic shuttles are more frequent I took the free airport shuttle bus from the international terminal to the domestic terminal. I was in terminal 2 and the shuttle stop is halfway through and it's by parking lot 3 -- I had to ask two people to figure this out as it wasn't extremely clear. The shuttle ran every 15 mins and the distance was around 15-20 mins.
reviews.title: Clean, painless stay with convenient shuttle

reviews.text: The hotel is by a 7 eleven which made it convenient to buy some snacks or dinner. Unfortunately my flight out was too early to try the breakfast.
reviews.title: All the basics without the hefty price tag.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the last night of a Japan vacation. We had a 7am flight so wanted to be close to the airport. We had a twin room (all that was available when I booked). As already mentioned, room is small and bed is hard, but it was quiet, had all the necessary amenities and was very reasonable. They also have the free shuttle which starts at 4:15am for the international terminal. The shuttle was completely full, and the seats small, but it's a quick ride and couldn't be more convenient.
reviews.title: Works well for an early departure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's also a computer and printer in the lobby to use for free, so good for printing boarding passes. They even had croissants to go for the early departures.
reviews.title: Tolerable for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this is a good deal if you have an early departure from Haneda.
reviews.title: Good value stay close to Airport
Convenient airport hotel, perfect between flights
reviews.text: The rooms are tiny, and the bed pretty much just fits in the tiny space from wall to wall. The bed was really hard and uncomfortable. Can't complain though cause we only checked in at midnight and were out by 9 the next morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amenities are provided, as well as sleeping gowns. There is free WiFi in the rooms, which is helpful. Probably would go for somewhere else if staying for longer.
reviews.title: convenient if arriving late or departing early

aka: Toyoko Inn Haneda Airport 2 Hotel Ota
